plan: In the first five rounds, I'll alternate between bidding my value and slightly above it to test aggressive strategies. For rounds 6-10, I'll bid slightly below my value to observe conservative tactics. In rounds 11-13, I'll mirror the highest previous bid to test reactive strategies. In the last two rounds, I'll analyze the patterns and choose between aggressive or conservative bids based on previous outcomes. This approach allows for data collection on different strategies while aiming to maximize profit over the 15 rounds.

In the initial rounds, I'll test the dominant strategy by bidding my exact value to establish a baseline. Simultaneously, I'll analyze opponents' bidding patterns. Mid-game, I'll experiment with slightly underbidding to gauge risk and potential savings. In later rounds, I'll test overbidding when my value is high to aggressively secure wins, considering potential profit versus cost. I'll adapt based on observed opponent behavior, focusing on maximizing profit by balancing risk and reward. Ties will be strategically considered to exploit potential randomness in outcomes. This adaptive approach will refine my strategy for optimal long-term profit.
